items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s AI startups?
items.summary:
- The article presents a list of active investors in Southeast Asia’s AI sector over the past two years.
- It emphasizes the number of deals done, favoring early-stage investors.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region within the specified timeframe are featured.

items.title: US State Dept pauses $400m armored EV plan involving Tesla
items.summary:
- The US State Department has paused a US$400 million purchase of armored EVs involving Tesla.
- Tesla was the only manufacturer to show interest since May 2024, but no contracts were awarded.
- The request for bids, initially set for May 2025, is now indefinitely on hold without plans to resume.
- The agency revised its forecast, clarifying Tesla was mistakenly listed, with potential vendors including BMW instead.

items.title: OpenAI merges o3 into GPT-5, plans GPT-4.5 release first
items.author: Sam Altman
items.summary:
- OpenAI cancels the release of the o3 AI model, integrating its features into GPT-5.
- GPT-5 will be available for ChatGPT and its API, but no release date has been provided.
- Prior to GPT-5, OpenAI will release GPT-4.5 as the final version of its “non-chain-of-thought model.”

items.title: India to make its first chip by October 2025 under plan
items.summary:
- India plans to produce its first domestically manufactured semiconductor chip by September or October 2025, as announced by IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
- Tata Electronics is constructing a semiconductor unit in Dholera, Gujarat, in collaboration with Taiwan’s Powerchip Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation.
- Micron's assembly and testing facility in Sanand, Gujarat, is reported to be 60% complete.
- The Indian government has allocated 334 crore rupees (approximately US$38.52 million) to IISc Bengaluru for research in gallium nitride technology, important for telecommunications and power sectors.
- The first phase of the India Semiconductor Mission (ISM 1.0) includes upgrading a semiconductor lab in Mohali, with preparations for ISM 2.0 pending Cabinet approval.
- This initiative is part of India's effort to become a global semiconductor hub under the Semicon India program, which was launched in 2021 with an outlay of 76,000 crore rupees (US$8.76 billion).

items.title: Perplexity unveils ‘Deep Research’ for fast, in-depth AI
items.summary:
- Perplexity has launched its "Deep Research" feature for in-depth research tasks, providing detailed answers with citations in finance, marketing, and product development.
- The feature became available on the web on Feb. 15 and will expand to Mac, iOS, and Android soon.
- Users can perform multi-step analyses, generating reports that can be exported as PDFs or shared as Perplexity Pages.
- It achieved a score of 21.1% on Humanity’s Last Exam, outperforming Gemini Thinking (6.2%) and GPT-4o (3.3%), but below OpenAI’s Deep Research (26.6%).
- Unlike OpenAI’s $200 monthly subscription model, Perplexity offers a freemium model with limited free queries and unlimited access for subscribers.
- Perplexity completes tasks in under three minutes, faster than OpenAI’s 5 to 30 minutes.
- The focus is on accessibility and speed, contrasting with OpenAI’s enterprise user model and Google’s integration with productivity tools.

items.title: Indian loyalty startup raises $1.85m seed funding
items.author: Abhinav Jain, Apurv Modi
items.summary:
- Almonds.ai, an India-based loyalty and rewards platform, raised ₹16 crore (US$1.85 million) in seed funding.
- Funding led by promoters of Haldiram’s and JITO Incubation and Innovation Foundation, with participation from several investors.
- Founded in 2020, Almonds.ai plans to use funds to improve AI technology and expand internationally, with operations launched in Dubai and partnerships in Singapore.
- In FY24, reported revenue of ₹35 crore (US$4.04 million) with a 12% EBITDA margin, targeting over ₹200 crore (US$23.06 million) in revenue for FY25 at a 15% EBITDA margin.

items.title: Chinese spatial tech firm seeks HK IPO after Nasdaq setback
items.summary:
- Manycore Tech, a Chinese start-up specializing in spatial design, has filed for an IPO in Hong Kong.
- The company previously attempted to list on Nasdaq three years ago but was unsuccessful.
- Founded in 2011, Manycore claims to operate the world’s largest spatial design platform.
- The IPO is backed by JPMorgan and CCB International; the funding target remains undisclosed but was previously reported as US$200 million.
- In 2023, Manycore was noted for having the highest number of monthly active users among spatial design platforms globally and leading China’s sector in revenue.
- The company has attracted investments from IDG Capital, Hillhouse Investment, and Coatue Management, achieving a valuation of US$2 billion after a 2020 funding round.

items.title: Uber sues DoorDash over alleged anti-competitive tactics
items.summary:
- Uber has filed a lawsuit against DoorDash in the Superior Court of California, claiming anti-competitive practices.
- The lawsuit alleges DoorDash pressures restaurants into exclusive delivery agreements, limiting competition.
- DoorDash denies these allegations, stating it manages delivery for over 90% of large restaurant chains in the US.
- Uber cites reports of restaurants feeling pressured with threats of higher fees if they use Uber’s service.
- The company is seeking a jury trial, with specific damages not disclosed.

items.title: Xi Jinping to meet tech leaders as DeepSeek advances tech
items.summary:
- Chinese President Xi Jinping will meet with 20 to 30 top private-sector entrepreneurs in Beijing on Feb. 17.
- Attendees include leaders from major technology firms, including the 'Six Little Dragons' from Hangzhou.
- The discussion focuses on advancements in technology and comes before China’s annual legislative and political advisory sessions addressing economic recovery and US trade challenges.
- The meeting follows developments from firms like Huawei and DeepSeek launching technologies to counter US trade restrictions.

items.title: Bangladesh in talks with Elon Musk on Starlink launch
items.summary:
- Bangladesh is in discussions with Elon Musk regarding the launch of Starlink, his satellite internet service.
- The initiative aims to improve internet access across Bangladesh, especially in rural areas.
- Starlink could potentially enhance connectivity and provide high-speed internet to underserved populations.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores funding trends and notable investors in Southeast Asia.
- It includes two sections: 'weekly update' for recent data points and 'macro trends' for an overview of funding distribution across regions and sectors.
- Visuals and infographics are utilized to present data, but premium content restrictions apply.

items.title: OpenAI board rejects Elon Musk’s $94.7b takeover bid
items.summary:
- OpenAI’s board rejected Elon Musk’s $97.4 billion acquisition bid, stating that "OpenAI is not for sale."  
- Musk aimed to return OpenAI to its open-source roots with backing from investors.  
- CEO Sam Altman criticized the bid as a hindrance to progress, and legal counsel asserted that competitors cannot dictate OpenAI’s mission.  
- Musk's bid followed lawsuits against OpenAI related to its for-profit model, with indications of withdrawing if OpenAI abandons its profit-driven approach.  
- The board's decision occurs as OpenAI seeks fundraising with SoftBank, potentially valuing the company at $300 billion.

items.title: Bitcoin transactions drop 55% as traders move elsewhere
items.summary:
- Bitcoin's 7-day moving average transactions fell to 330,000, a 55% drop from 730,000.
- Transaction fees have remained steady at approximately US$500,000 for the last month.
- Runes and Ordinals now represent only 1% of total bitcoin transactions.
- Fee revenue from Runes dropped to under US$20,000 from US$60 million at its launch.
- Traders are shifting interest to Solana for memecoin trading and Base for AI agent tokens.
- Concerns arise about bitcoin's fee-based model and long-term sustainability as block rewards decrease.
- Engagement with new protocols will be crucial for bitcoin's future.

items.title: Apple’s Siri revamp faces delays due to software issues
items.summary:
- Apple’s Siri revamp may be delayed due to software bugs and engineering challenges.
- Originally scheduled for an April launch with iOS 18.4, updates could be postponed until May or later.
- Some employees reported inconsistencies, prompting Apple to consider a release in an inactive state first for iOS 18.5.
- Key upgrades aim to enhance file retrieval, but features like scanning emails for travel plans may be delayed.
- Setbacks could affect Apple’s upcoming smart home hub that depends on Siri’s functions.
- Despite challenges, Apple is committed to AI advancements; strong iPhone sales noted in regions with Apple Intelligence.
- Further improvements to Siri expected to continue until 2026.

items.title: Meta launches AI-powered humanoid robotics division
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms is launching a new AI-powered humanoid robotics division in its Reality Labs.
- The division aims to compete with companies like Nvidia-backed Figure AI and Tesla.
- CTO Andrew Bosworth shared that the team will develop consumer humanoid robots using Meta’s Llama AI models.
- Marc Whitten, former CEO of Cruise, is leading the effort, with John Koryl appointed as VP of Retail.
- Despite losing about $5 billion in Q4 2024, Meta is committed to AI-driven robotics.
- The company is investing in “embodied AI” and collaborating with Unitree Robotics and Figure AI.
- Meta is currently testing retail strategies and has delayed its branded robot hardware.

items.title: Musk’s xAI seeks $10b funding, eyes $75b valuation
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s AI company, xAI, is looking to raise approximately US$10 billion in funding, potentially valuing the company at US$75 billion.
- Existing investors like Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Valor Equity Partners are in discussions for participation.
- xAI was previously valued at US$51 billion after raising US$6 billion across two rounds in 2024.
- The company aims to compete with OpenAI, featuring its chatbot Grok integrated into Musk’s platform X.
- A public release of the Grok 3 chatbot is anticipated soon.
- xAI is negotiating a server purchase deal with Dell Technologies exceeding US$5 billion.

items.title: TSMC weighs control of Intel’s US plants after Trump talks
items.summary:
- TSMC is considering a controlling stake in Intel’s US factories after discussions with the Trump administration.
- The potential deal aims to enhance US chip manufacturing and secure leadership in critical technologies.
- Key negotiation involves TSMC possibly managing Intel’s production facilities to help address Intel’s financial difficulties and support localization efforts.
- Intel has not disclosed its position, but concerns about foreign control have been raised by a White House official.
- Intel is facing financial challenges and has been cutting jobs and scaling back expansion plans.
- Federal officials are exploring partnerships with other chipmakers as strategic options.
- TSMC previously showed no interest in Intel’s factories but may be reconsidering due to increasing US-China tech tensions.
- Both TSMC and Intel have declined to comment on the potential deal.

items.title: Microsoft-backed robotics startup eyes $39.5b valuation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Figure AI, focused on humanoid robots, aims to secure US$1.5 billion in funding for a valuation of US$39.5 billion.
- This valuation is a significant increase from US$2.6 billion last year.
- Current investors include Microsoft, OpenAI, Nvidia, and Jeff Bezos.
- The company is leveraging advancements in reasoning technology for faster adoption of robots, targeting home use within a few years.
- Figure AI aims to help address labor shortages by performing dangerous tasks, with BMW AG as a customer.
- The interest in robotics is growing, with projects from Tesla and Meta involving collaborations with companies like Figure and Unitree Robotics.

items.title: Something for every curious mind 🧠
items.summary:
- The article discusses various funding deals across industries, including fintech and brain-computer interfaces.
- Significant investments include Tabby raising US$160 million in Series E funding and Harrison.ai raising US$112 million in Series C.
- Includes a list of mergers and acquisitions such as Kartini's acquisition by Libera Global AI and Joper.app's acquisition by KiranaPro.
- The article highlights the challenges of fundraising and promotes a platform called Glasswall for feedback on investors.
- Features insights into tech networking events across Southeast Asia, emphasizing opportunities for founders and investors.

items.title: Japan’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Anthropic opposes US ban on Google’s AI investments
items.summary:
- Anthropic has requested a federal court to dismiss a US government proposal restricting Google’s investments in AI companies.
- The proposal aims to combat Google’s monopolization of the online search market, as found by a federal judge last year.
- Suggested measures include a forced sale of Google’s Chrome browser and investment bans in firms managing consumer search data.
- Anthropic, funded with around US$3 billion from Google, argues the restrictions could harm competition and benefit rivals like OpenAI, Meta, and DeepMind.
- The San Francisco-based AI startup states that the proposal would impede its progress in the industry.

items.title: UK government partners with Anthropic to implement AI in public services
items.summary:
- The UK government has signed an agreement with AI startup Anthropic to explore using its chatbot, Claude, in public services.
- The initiative aims to improve citizen interactions with public information and services.
- Anthropic, backed by Google and Amazon, announced the collaboration through a memorandum of understanding.
- This partnership aligns with Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s strategy to advance AI development in the UK.
- Claude is already used in institutions like the European Parliament for improving document searches.
- The collaboration supports the UK government’s goal of integrating innovative technologies into public services with proper regulations.

items.title: UK Tech Startup Plain Secures $15M Series A
items.author: Simon Rohrbach, Matt Vagni
items.summary:
- UK-based startup Plain raised $15 million in a series A round led by Battery Ventures, with participation from Index Ventures and Connect Ventures.
- The funding will facilitate expansion, including opening its first US office in San Francisco.
- Plain, founded by former Deliveroo employees, offers an API-based platform that consolidates customer support channels such as Slack, Microsoft Teams, Discord, email, and chat.
- Notable customers include Sanity, Laravel, Stytch, and Raycast.
- The customer support sector is experiencing growth, with new players like Pylon and Thena emerging.

items.title: Saudi digital bank Derayah sets IPO price at $8 per share
items.summary:
- Derayah Financial Company set its IPO offer price at 30 riyal (US$8) per share.
- The IPO attracted total orders of 243 billion riyal (US$64.79 billion), oversubscribing by about 162 times.
- The company is valued at 7.5 billion riyal (US$2 billion) upon listing, with a total offering size of 1.5 billion riyal (US$400 million).
- 49,947,039 ordinary shares are included, representing 20% of the company’s capital.
- Subscription period for individual investors is from Feb. 20 to Feb. 22.
- Listing date on Saudi Arabia’s Main Market will be confirmed after regulatory approvals.
- HSBC Saudi Arabia is the financial advisor and underwriter for the offering.

items.title: Forrest Li considers running for SG football assoc. presidency
items.summary:
- Billionaire and Sea Limited founder Forrest Li is reportedly considering running for the presidency of the Football Association of Singapore (FAS).
- A spokesperson for Li confirmed he is evaluating his candidacy following suggestions from the football community.
- Li is a naturalized Singapore citizen born in Tianjin, China, and has served as a FAS council member from 2017 to 2021.

items.title: Chinese EV firm Zeekr to unveil self-driving system
items.summary:
- Zeekr Intelligent Technology, a subsidiary of Geely Auto, will unveil its Level 3 autonomous driving system at the Shanghai Auto Show in April 2025.
- Zeekr recently merged with Lynk, acquiring a 51% stake, which strengthens Geely's premium EV ecosystem.
- The in-house L3 system claims improvements in computing power, performance, safety, and structural design.
- Zeekr is among several Chinese automakers, like BYD, that are expanding into autonomous driving technology.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- Fundraising is challenging, and this article lists fundraising startups for easier access.
- Startups can sign up for a listing to reach investors via email.
- Investors can opt-in to receive curated lists of fundraising startups if they are paying subscribers.

items.title: Airbnb to launch AI customer support system
items.summary:
- Airbnb plans to implement AI in customer support operations starting Q4 2024, with a rollout expected in summer 2024.
- The AI system aims to function as a customer service agent with capabilities to handle multiple languages and large data.
- CEO Brian Chesky stated AI is still in development and is not ready for trip planning or advanced integrations yet.
- Future AI developments may enhance search functions and concierge-like features.
- CFO Ellie Mertz mentioned potential cost efficiencies in customer service and payment processing due to AI.

items.title: Mobility platform Rapido to launch women-only bike taxis
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based Rapido plans to launch a women-only bike taxi service called “Pink Bikes” in Karnataka by the end of 2025.
- The service will feature female drivers exclusively for female passengers.
- Co-founder Pavan Guntupalli aims to create 25,000 job opportunities for women and ensure safer commutes.
- This initiative follows Uber India's launch of “Uber Moto Women” in December 2024 with 250 female riders.
- The move reflects a trend among ride-hailing companies focusing on safety and inclusivity for women.

items.title: Airbnb shares surge 15% after strong Q4 earnings
items.summary:
- Airbnb’s shares increased by 15% in after-hours trading on February 13, following stronger-than-expected Q4 earnings.
- The company reported earnings of 73 cents per share, exceeding the anticipated 58 cents, with revenues of $2.48 billion, up 12% YoY.
- Net income improved to $461 million from a loss of $349 million last year.
- Q1 2025 revenue projections were slightly below analysts’ expectations at $2.23 billion to $2.27 billion.
- Key metrics included a 4% rise in adjusted profit to $765 million and 111 million booked nights and experiences, a 12% increase.
- The average daily rate rose by 1% to $158, with over five million hosts and eight million active listings currently.
- Airbnb.org has aided over 19,000 individuals and 2,300 pets affected by wildfires in Los Angeles.
- The company attributes improved conversion rates to tech upgrades and plans to launch new offerings in May.

items.title: Indian electric bus manufacturer raises $29m funding
items.summary:
- PMI Electro Mobility has raised ₹250 crore (US$29 million) through a funding round via preferential allotment of equity shares.
- Investors include Authum Investment & Infrastructure, Gruhas, Antique Securities, and several high-net-worth family offices.
- Funds will be used to improve production capabilities, scale operations, and develop new solutions.
- Founded in 2017, PMI operates a fleet of 2,000 electric buses across 31 cities with an annual manufacturing capacity of over 2,500 buses.
- PMI holds an order book for more than 3,000 vehicles and previously secured ₹250 crore from Piramal Alternative Funds in 2023.
- The funding coincides with India's push for electric vehicle adoption, backed by the PM E-DRIVE scheme for over 14,000 electric buses.
- India's EV market is valued at US$54 billion and is projected to reach US$132 billion by 2030, indicating significant growth opportunities.

items.title: Rebel Foods launches 15-minute delivery app
items.summary:
- Rebel Foods has launched a 15-minute food delivery service via its app ‘QuickiES’ in select locations in Mumbai.
- The app features food from over 45 brands, including Faasos, Wendy’s, and Oven Story Pizza.
- This service competes with Zomato’s Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart in the fast food delivery market.
- The competitive landscape is intensifying with interest from larger e-commerce companies like Flipkart and Amazon.
- Rebel Foods, founded in 2011, has raised $773 million from investors and may consider a public listing within the next 12 to 18 months.

items.title: Italy probes Amazon for $1.26b tax evasion, faces $3b bill
items.summary:
- Italian prosecutors are investigating Amazon and three executives for alleged tax evasion of €1.2 billion (US$1.26 billion).
- The inquiry focuses on possible fraud linked to online sales in Italy from 2019 to 2021, with suspicions about non-EU sellers avoiding VAT.
- Amazon could face a tax bill of up to €3 billion (US$3.15 billion), including penalties and interest, potentially affecting its business model in Europe.

items.title: Bhutan to test AI chatbot for Buddhist teachings
items.summary:
- Bhutan will test an AI chatbot named BuddhaBot Plus for Buddhist teachings.
- The pilot program involves collaboration among Bhutan's Central Monastic Body, Kyoto University, and Teraverse Co. Ltd., with 200 monks participating and full rollout by 2027.
- The chatbot was developed in 2021, enhanced with OpenAI's ChatGPT, and its English version completed in 2023.
- The trial will take place at institutions like Tango Buddhist College and the Institute of Science of Mind, assessing effectiveness over six months.
- Bhutan is the first country outside Japan to trial this English version.
- Professor Seiji Kumagai highlights potential impacts on Buddhist education and interfaith dialogue, but there are concerns regarding data reliability and ethics.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: eFishery, Telio make deep cuts
items.summary:
[eFishery and Telio announced significant layoffs amid the ongoing trend in the Asian tech sector.]
[The layoffs come as companies continue to adjust to economic pressures and changing market conditions.]
[This tracker provides an overview of layoffs across various startups in Asia.]

items.title: Meta’s shift under Trump worries employees, sources say
items.summary:
- Mark Zuckerberg’s alignment of Meta with the Trump administration has raised employee concerns.
- Internal criticism focuses on content moderation policies and workplace culture.
- Meta has changed its moderation approach and cut DEI programs since Trump’s re-election.
- Approximately 5% of the workforce was laid off this week, following cuts from 2022 and 2023.
- Zuckerberg is also targeting Apple, criticizing its App Store policies that impact Meta’s profitability.
- Employees express uncertainty about Meta's workplace culture under recent changes.

items.title: Nvidia cuts Arm stake, invests in WeRide, exits others
items.summary:
- Nvidia reduced its stake in Arm Holdings by 43.8%, now holding 1.1 million shares as of February 14.
- Nvidia invested in WeRide, acquiring 1.7 million shares, leading to a 96% increase in WeRide's shares during premarket trading.
- Nvidia exited positions in Serve Robotics, SoundHound AI, and Nano-X Imaging, with Serve Robotics shares dropping by 31% after the exit and SoundHound AI and Nano-X Imaging shares also falling by 10% and 4% respectively.
- Nvidia holds 1.2 million shares in Nebius Group, which saw a 6% rise in its shares.

items.title: HashKey secures $30m investment, now valued at $1.5b
items.summary:
- Gaorong Ventures has invested US$30 million in HashKey Group, a Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency firm.
- This investment values HashKey at nearly US$1.5 billion post-funding.
- HashKey operates one of Hong Kong’s first licensed crypto exchanges and provides services such as crypto trading and asset management.
- The firm has expanded to Singapore, Japan, and Bermuda since its founding in 2018.
- The investment indicates growing interest in crypto from Chinese investors despite the 2021 mainland China ban.
- Global funding for crypto startups reached US$10 billion in 2024, down from US$10.3 billion in 2023 according to PitchBook.

items.title: Douyin hit $490b GMV in 2024, 30% higher than previous year
items.summary:
- Douyin Ecommerce achieved a GMV of approximately 3.5 trillion yuan (about US$490 billion) in 2024.
- This reflects a 30% increase from the previous year.
- Douyin became the 3rd largest ecommerce platform in China, after Alibaba and Pinduoduo.
- The platform shifted sales strategies from a low-price focus to emphasizing GMV targets in 2024.
- Shelf-based shopping generated over 40% of total GMV, with merchant-led and influencer-led livestreams contributing slightly more than 30% each.
- Douyin targets a GMV of 4.2 trillion yuan (US$586 billion) for 2025.

items.title: OpenAI teams up with UK’s Guardian to integrate journalism
items.summary:
[OpenAI and UK’s Guardian collaborate on integrating journalism and AI.]
[The partnership aims to improve the efficiency and quality of news reporting.]
[Details about the tools or specific technologies to be used in the collaboration remain unspecified.]

items.title: VinFast EV deliveries soar 192 percent, beat targets in 2024
items.summary:
- VinFast Auto Ltd. delivered 53,139 electric vehicles (EVs) globally in Q4 2024, a 143% increase from Q3 and a 342% rise from Q4 2023.
- Total global deliveries for 2024 reached 97,399 EVs, surpassing the revised target of 80,000, marking a 192% year-over-year increase.
- VinFast plans to at least double its global deliveries in 2025 and will release financial results on April 24, 2025.

items.title: New AI bot SOHAI tricks WhatsApp scammers
items.summary:
- A new AI tool called Scammers On Hold AI (SOHAI) has been launched to disrupt scam operations on WhatsApp.
- SOHAI interacts with scammers to waste their time and prevent them from targeting victims.
- Users can input SOHAI’s phone number when faced with a scammer, prompting the scammer to engage with an AI character named “Madam Soh,” who responds evasively to prolong conversations.

items.title: Tariffs cloud Una Brands’ 2025 outlook
items.summary:
- Una Brands recorded a 4.8% revenue growth in 2023 despite challenges in the ecommerce sector.
- The company achieved EBITDA profitability in Q4 2023 but faces uncertainty for 2025 due to tariffs imposed by the US.
- Tariffs on imports from China are a major concern for the ecommerce industry, although Una Brands believes its local China team gives it a competitive edge.

items.title: Car-sharing platform cancels IPO after revenue slowdown
items.summary:
- Turo canceled its planned IPO, as per a regulatory filing on Feb. 13.
- The company had announced plans for an IPO in 2021 and filed in January 2022, but faced delays due to unfavorable market conditions.
- CEO Andre Haddad stated "now is not the right time" for the IPO; Turo will focus on long-term value.
- Revenue grew from US$150 million in 2020 to US$958 million in 2024, but momentum has slowed since the pandemic peak.
- Turo has been profitable since 2022, but net income fell from US$154.7 million in 2022 to US$14.7 million in 2023.
- Competitor Getaround announced the shutdown of its US operations, indicating ongoing challenges in the car-sharing industry.

items.title: OpenAI replaces DEI page with focus on ‘dynamic teams’
items.summary:
- OpenAI has replaced its DEI webpage with a new focus on 'building dynamic teams'.
- The change appeared to be implemented between January 22 and January 27.
- The previous DEI page emphasized diversity and inclusion, while the new page highlights collaboration without explicitly mentioning diversity.

items.title: Phase design platform raises $13m in funding
items.author: Nick Budden
items.summary:
- Phase, a design platform for UI/UX designers, launched out of beta with $13 million in funding.
- The startup is based in Taipei and Berlin and received investments from Gobi Partners, 500 Global, 42CAP, and Palm Drive Capital.
- Founded in 2017, Phase offers a WYSIWYG platform for creating interactive simulations without manual coding and exporting production-ready UI code.

items.title: Google’s Gemini adds recall feature for past chats
items.summary:
- Gemini, an AI tool developed by Google, introduces a recall feature for Gemini Advanced subscribers on the Google One AI Premium Plan.
- Feature allows users to reference past conversations for follow-ups or summaries without restarting discussions.
- Users can review, delete, or control chat history storage, with the option to disable it via My Activity settings.
- Currently available only in English; more languages and access for Google Workspace Business and Enterprise users coming soon.

items.title: GlobalWafers says US CHIPS Act changes may affect investment
items.summary:
- GlobalWafers has not received notifications about potential subsidy changes under the US CHIPS and Science Act.
- The company states any modifications could impact future investments.
- In December 2024, US Commerce Department finalized $406 million in grants for GlobalWafers to enhance production in Texas and Missouri.
- Reports suggest the White House may renegotiate some awards, leading to concerns about delays in semiconductor subsidies.
- Recent developments include reviews of CHIPS Act subsidies with unclear terms and details of ongoing and upcoming investments.

items.title: Taiwan strengthen US ties in semiconductor industry
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s President Lai Ching-te pledged to strengthen semiconductor ties with the US to address supply chain security concerns.
- Taiwan is emphasized as crucial in the global semiconductor industry with a strong focus on collaborative strategies with the US.
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) is central to AI chip production, investing US$65 billion in facilities including Arizona.
- Lai promotes a “democratic supply chain” amid criticisms from former President Trump regarding Taiwan weakening US semiconductor manufacturing.
- Taiwan's semiconductor-driven trade surplus with the US surged 83% to a record US$111.4 billion despite the lack of formal diplomacy.

items.title: Taiwan’s chip tester sees growth despite US tariff risks
items.summary:
- Chunghwa Precision Test Technology (CHPT) expects minimal impact from potential US tariffs due to most operations in Taiwan.
- Expanded its San Jose subsidiary in 2022, increasing capacity fourfold to meet demand for AI chip and smartphone processor testing.
- North America accounted for 60% of revenue in 2023.
- President Scott Huang projects strong 2025 growth driven by AI and high-performance computing.
- For Q4 2024, CHPT reported a record net profit of NT$322 million (US$9.8 million) and annual net profit of NT$510 million (US$15.5 million).
